website_summaries.verdict: Although designed with heavier users in mind, the bariatric rollator is a great choice for anyone who seeks a heavy-duty mobility aid. Has a wide, comfortable seat.
pros: Wider seat and handles more comfortable for larger users up to 500 pounds
cons: Does not fit easily through some doorways

customer_reviews.title: Cannot support people of size contrary to its weight limit of 500lbs
customer_reviews.text: My father is 315lbs and has gone through two of these. It’s a great concept but is not quality made. Both time one of the wheels completely fell off and after further inspection the wheel bearings were completely stripped. This product says it can support up to 500lbs so that means the wheels should have held. Amazon replaced it once but will not send a second one. I’ve been referred to the manufacturer and reaching someone that can help me there is a headache.
customer_reviews.author: Pyang

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it a 0* I would. I bought this on 10/30. 1st one arrived and I could not put it together because the rear wheel would not fit into the tube it was supposed to snap into. I got a replacement quickly from Amazon, yesterday (11/23) some 10 days since I started using the second one sent (and I use it sporadically), the front wheel came off...and I can't put it back on. I suggest you look for another brand that is sturdy and would last longer.
customer_reviews.author: My Views

customer_reviews.title: Easy, fast and love it.
customer_reviews.text: I about fainted when I first opened the box. Thought it was all in pieces BUT when I got into putting it together, it was very easy and well thought out by the manufacturer as to the physical abilities (or lack of) of the person putting it together. Make sure you watch the short instructional video and you won't have any problems. No tools required. Great job, guys and gals. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bruce

customer_reviews.title: I have purchased one in May 2017 and another in ...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased one in May 2017 and another in July 2017. I am currently in need of a 3rd unit. The wheels fail. Bearings fall out leaving bird shot all over the floor. today the front wheel is coming apart on the axel.
customer_reviews.author: barryvonada

customer_reviews.title: Allowed me to return to work sooner.
customer_reviews.text: Thankfully no longer need to use this. However, at the time it arrived and for a few weeks it made me mobile and able to work. I have extremely long hallways at work. Have the security of the walker and being able to rest when I needed to, made all of the difference. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Margie L.

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY MEDLINE!
customer_reviews.text: This is not a review of the rollator, but of Medline, the manufacturer. The unit I received was missing two small parts. So I called Medline using the Customer Service (Ha Ha) number in the assembly instructions. They couldn't have been LESS helpful. They not only wouldn't replace the missing parts, they end up denying the rollator was theirs. If you have one of these rollators and trouble develops, good luck to you! By the way, it's made in China. Edward Dunn 10/23/2016
customer_reviews.author: Edward Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Not even two months old and falling apart
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our mother and not just over a month of having it, the outside bearing of the left rear wheel came apart and dumped ball bearings everywhere. We are trying to find a replacement wheel, but honestly the whole unit should be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: B. M. Richwine

customer_reviews.title: Broke within two weeks of using it.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased TWO of these walkers. The first was about 6 months ago. I had to replace that one because the front, right wheel broke straight off. Thought it was just a fluke. Purchased another on December 31, 2017 because the replacement parts are nearly as much as a new one. Less than TWO WEEKS of using the new one the same right front wheel broke off. I don’t think what would be considered a fluke, I won’t be purchasing another one.
customer_reviews.author: Angela S

customer_reviews.title: Great priduct... but I have a couple of questions.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product it works great however, I find it kind of awkward to fold up and put in the car. For some reason for me it doesn't want to stay folded up. If anyone has any suggestions great please let me know. Also, I've included a picture and I would like to know what this strap thing that I'm pointing at is used for?
customer_reviews.author: Tonya B.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I got this rollator only two months ago and it’s already falling apart! One of the wheels just fell off when I was using it. I nearly fell. Definitely returning this. I was hoping this would replace my old five year old rollator. My old one wasn’t even “heavy duty” and it lasted five years!! The quality of this one is horrid.
customer_reviews.author: J. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware....quality might be an issue.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product on Nov. 9th. Two months later on Jan. 10th front right wheel fell off. It appears the attachment where the wheel is supposed to be screwed into is stripped. After reading several other reviews about the lack of customer support and no chance of getting replacement parts, I ordered a replacement walker. I can hardly walk without my walker and it was promised in two days. No such luck. Two days gone and no replacement walker to be seen. Not happy with first one and the second one isn't here to replace it. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Ikerry

customer_reviews.title: Wheel broke within one month and brakes rub. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Wheel broke within one month and brakes rub. I am having to order a new and different kind. Very unhappy with this walker. On-line reviews say I am not alone.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Nooshazar

customer_reviews.title: THE TIRES CAVED IN SOON AS I SAT ON IT ...
customer_reviews.text: THE TIRES CAVED IN SOON AS I SAT ON IT, AND I DON'T WEIGH 400LBS. IT'S RATED 0. I AM VERY DISPLEASED!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, big wheels (which she needed)
customer_reviews.text: This was for my daughter, who is in a nursing facility. Excellent value, big wheels (which she needed). I would order again in a heartbeat. Great service. THANK YOU....
customer_reviews.author: Diane G. Meuret

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately, the guy who uses this doesn't know any ...
customer_reviews.text: It isn't that heavy, but it is deceptively large and bulky making it difficult to fit in trunks and back seats. Also, when "folded" it does not lock in place so there is the real danger of getting you fingers caught or cracking yourself in the shin with a support bar. And there are some razor sharp wires in some prime real estate on this that has left me dripping blood on more than one occasion. Fortunately, the guy who uses this doesn't know any of this.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Tonin

customer_reviews.title: I just can't recommend this rollator.
customer_reviews.text: I very seldom use this rollator. It's my spare I carry with me in my van in case I need it. The other day, I noticed one of the front wheels was rubbing against the fork. The fork is bad. The part that goes into the front leg looks bent. I checked Amazon, and I would have to buy a pair of them at about $45.00 + $9.95 shipping. (Not covered by Prime membership). Considering the entire rollator is only $86.01, the price is outrageous. (No, I don't weigh 500 lbs.) The bearings are also bad. I have grave doubts about the material used to construct this.
customer_reviews.author: OldTech1

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sturdy folding walker with brakes
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent walker for anyone recovering from surgery, who cannot stand for extended periods, or who needs a cane. We took this on a trip to Europe, and it was fabulous. Standing in long lines, it provided a place to sit. Maneuvers quite well, and the front bar removes, if the person wants to face forward and scoot along. To fold, you pull up on a strap. It does not lock into folded position, which was unwieldy sometimes. It is a bit heavy, but super sturdy. We recommend taking off the bar in front before giving to an airline, because ours came back with the foam ripped badly during baggage handling. Would highly recommend this walker.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. I would recommend before attempting assembly to go to Medline.com and entering the product number at the top. Search and you will get a list of product numbers. Click on the appropriate one and you will be supplied with a video to assist in assembly. This helps quite a bit and assembly is fast. Good quality and I have it ready for my first visit to the orthopedist tomorrow. I like the fact that it allows me to sit for a bit if the pain becomes too intense. I just wish the written instructions had more detail.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia E. Vasilj

customer_reviews.title: It is a good unit. This unit would have been a great ...
customer_reviews.text: The Rollator walker is heavy and it "don't fold down small". Walker only fold at the seat and is "NOT" compact . Hard to handle after folding 1 time because width don't fold down. There is "NO" height ajustment. It is a good unit. This unit would have been a great unit . "IF" had more adjustment in height,handle grips,back rest.
customer_reviews.author: Gary.Prater

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you are bigger person
customer_reviews.text: I love my new toy. It's a pretty dark maroon color. It was very easy to assemble and adjust to my height. It is lite weight but very sturdy and stable Easy to get it into trunk. I'm a big person and it is the perfect seat and walker width. I'm facing knee replacement surgery and this has helped me tremendously
customer_reviews.author: nono1

customer_reviews.title: Wheel bearing broke
customer_reviews.text: I had ankle surgery after Christmas and needed something to help me get around at home. Unfortunately the wheel bearings broke in the wheel and caused me to fall. I purposefully bought this model as I’m heavy but well within the weight restriction. I’m disappointed that I have to return this item in order to receive a full refund when the device isn’t usable.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: Great Walker
customer_reviews.text: Since my purchase I have been able to get the much needed support so I can get out of the house become somewhat active again. I like the rugged design, the many adjustments, the large wheel allow walking on rough terrain for the most part...doesn't like crushed stone...otherwise I am able to go to Festivals, Flea Markets, etc When I get tired I have a seat handy and the seat lifts up for my personal item I need for the day. The functionality of this unit far out weighs the extra weight. I can load it in the bed of my pickup alone.
customer_reviews.author: SRP846

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty and makes walking much easier. Going to the doctors office or hospital with my cane was extremely painful with no where to rest in the hallways. With this I can walk longer distances and longer duration and sit when I reach my limit. Medline also has great customer service. I sent the following message to Medline: I just want to let you know what great service I received from Vanessa Allen. I had an issue with my walker (rollator). She was so helpful and quick to respond. My walker is fixed and I am a very happy customer. I plan to purchase more products from Medline. Great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Livergood

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This Rollator is absolutely flawless. I got the smaller, regular size for myself and my son, who has arthritis, wanted one for himself. He is as happy with his heavy-duty one as I am with mine. Neither of us would change a thing. This rollator has a comfortable seat; the wheels roll easily; the brakes hold really tight, and it's attractive and well-made. They are both a definite 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Granny

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase ever. Arrived on time, and was easy to put together. Is very sturdy and can hold a lot of weight and is wide enough for a very large obese person.. It is easy to fold up and put in small trunks. It is not too heavy to lift. It wheels around easily and brakes work great. Seat is sturdy and comfortable. it doesn't fit through normal doorways very well and you have to fold it to get it through to some rooms.
customer_reviews.author: imkaty

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: My husband used this during a 3 day vintage book & magazine convention that we attended. It worked great to hold all his (many!) purchases in the basket. He also liked having a place to sit down that was easy for him to get up from; both in the dealer room and in the restaurant. It was a little difficult getting it thru the door into our hotel room just because it's so wide. I don't think he'll be able to use it at home because of that but overall it worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Karen G

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Rollator!!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I had hoped it would be! It is extremely sturdy, comfortable, and easy to use. I am 5'7" and the height can be adjusted to a comfortable level. It move smoothly and brakes well. The extra width and well padded seat provides a very comfortable seating area. You might want to check the seating height before you purchase, as it sits fairly high. I have really enjoyed the freedom it has given me to get out and about without the worry of falling or finding somewhere to rest if I get tired. I am incredibly pleased with my purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exceptionally Well Built - Helps me a lot.
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint I have is that it is huge when I'm trying to put it in my car but I guess that's what I need to live with. I'm kinda huge too. This was easy to assemble, the instructions could have been a little better but I'm mechanically oriented and appreciated the brevity, others may not? It's making my life a little easier. Overcoming the stigma of walking with a contraption is a bit of a challenge, pride is hard to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: BULLDG

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is made sturdy and designed to handle big people. It is so easy to assemble a lot of owners will not have to look at the instructions more than once. If you have an older home that does not have ADA compliant doorways you may have trouble going through some of the doorways due to the width of this unit. However, its good points far outweigh the very few short comings it may have. This unit is going to enhance my being able to enjoy getting out more.
customer_reviews.author: TomPJr

customer_reviews.title: A BIG THUMBS DOWN!!
customer_reviews.text: I am well under the weight limit for this walker, but the wheel broke after only 3 months use. The problem is that the wheels do not swivel properly, so sometimes you are pushing on it and the wheel is locked sideways rather than swiveling around to accommodate the direction you are going. I have had walkers like this since 1998...this is the first one I found that was so poorly constructed. I was sorry to find it Amazon's Choice. A big thumbs DOWN.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Higley

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: This unit is great for large people that need a rolling walker. The wheels are very large so using it with on a carpeted surface or outside is no issue. Very easy to assemble. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of five is because the cross bar has give to it. Not a big deal but worth noting. Also since this unit is large, you may have issue going through doorways or into the rest room. We bought two of these and they are working out great.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth W.

customer_reviews.title: great walker for overweight people at great price
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this walker for my aging mom who has mobility issues and is on oxygen so needs to stop and sit often to catch her breath. She loves it! It's easy to use and is wide enough for someone quite overweight. When it arrived the box was torn and a piece was broken making it so we couldn't assemble the walker. My dad called the company and they sent a replacement walker immediately! Excellent customer service and a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Sara S.

customer_reviews.title: I love this rollator
customer_reviews.text: I love this rollator. Sturdy build makes me feel safe when I’m walking and sitting. The seat is nice and wide. Easy to assemble. It is heavy and a little awkward about staying folded up when you’re trying to get it out. I have a full size truck and it takes up half of the width of the back seat. My husband has to get it out and put it back.
customer_reviews.author: A Tackett

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good and sturdy item. I'm very happy that I got the larger size. It is perfect for me to walk around the block and rest when needed. I'm extremely pleased with it. I will order more products from this company as needed. Would highly recommend this item to anyone over 200 lbs. I find the strength of metal better than the aluminum ones.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy H

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Due to the size this item might be a bit large for small rooms/doors but works very nicely for me. Seat is nice and wide and very comfortable. I am 6' 1" and the handles at the highest adjustment works well for me. Like most walkers of this design (4 wheels) it tends to unfold when loading to the back of your car. You need to install a strap (either buckle or hook and loop)to keep it closed when lifting.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Buffington

customer_reviews.title: Reinvent the wheel
customer_reviews.text: I loved this walker at first. I have severe arthritis in my back and in my knees. This walker helped me do my job with minimal discomfort. 60 days later-one of the back wheels broke. I can't seem to get it fixed so the whole walker is trash.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Hanson

customer_reviews.title: It delivers all that it promises
customer_reviews.text: I am disabled and my mobility in my home is limited. I purchased this walker to help me move about my home with help because my lower extremities are week and my balance is hindered by neuropathy. I am able to use the seat to rest when I feel like I can no longer stand up. I am a larger woman and I made sure this was a higher weight capacity, which it is by more than 175 pounds over my current weight. I also like the fold up feature as well.
customer_reviews.author: MomMom

customer_reviews.title: Good walker just bought bigger than I needed
customer_reviews.text: Excellent walker. Sturdy. Prompt delivery. It was overkill. Didn’t really need it to be soooo big. 22” wide doesn’t fit through some doorways. I do use it outdoors on rugged terrain so 8 inch wheels probably good but it is large, heavy and kind of a pain to put in and out of car trunk. It is extremely comfortable to sit in - seat height, width and depth great.
customer_reviews.author: Hat finder

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Really love it. Easy to put together. Sturdy and the seat has been comfortable so far. I've had no issues going through doors in public places, but bathroom doorway at home is too narrow. Rolls well inside and on low grass and sidewalks. I wish it was easier to guide when you need it to lean on. I like the bigger wheels. It's on the heavy side when I'm trying to lift it to get it in the car, but I'd rather know it has a sturdy frame so that's a trade-off. I use it every day. All in all I will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Wheel assemblies are clearly a problem
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 5 of these in the last 2 years, every time having trouble with the wheels falling apart. On one occasion I contacted Medline, who sent me a replacement, which also did the same thing. So if there were a star rating for durability, I would have to give them 1 star out of 5. Having read numerous other reviews, I know I'm not the only one to have experienced these issues, so I would say bear that in mind when purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: CheckItOutReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Super rollator!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this rollator. It is more stable than a rollator that i already owned. I have back problems and bad arthritis in my hips, knees and ankles and I use this rollator everyday. I liked it so well that I bought one for my elderly father who has the same arthritis problems that are worse than mine and he loves his too. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants a more stable and rugged rollator than the standard rollator. Excellent workmanship and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Marsharena

customer_reviews.title: made pretty well, my mother is approximately 300lb and says ...
customer_reviews.text: made pretty well, my mother is approximately 300lb and says that she feels confident sitting on and using this product. others that have claimed to be to this capability, were not nearly as sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Clyde

customer_reviews.title: same as other peoples concerns, some attributes are great about it though
customer_reviews.text: 2 months into use the rear left wheel fell off. I had all the parts and was able to do a temporary fix that lasted another day or two. That was it though. (stripped threads in screw, shredded washer) I use this for work and was hoping it would last a little longer. I had heard about the wheel issue so was very careful with the wheels. The height was perfect and the adjustment of the handlebars were perfect for me. The seat was comfortable and it almost fit through all the doors at work. It has it's pluses but make sure you register it after purchase for warranty issues.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Wheels problems.
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made. I bought it for my mother back in February 2020 and within 6 months I replaced parts in both rear wheels but after the front one completely broke off I give up. The website says up to 500 Lb but my mother is 115 so there are no reasons why it keep braking down every few months. We’re in August of 2020 and I’m done dealing and fixing this cheap crap. I’m getting a new one. 😰
customer_reviews.author: Excel Air

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, broke after 1 week
customer_reviews.text: This product broke with a 400 lb patient's normal use! I'm thankful they didn't fall!! We returned the item immediately and will not be buying it again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing! I bought it for my mother and she was able to use it and turn it with ease. I put it together myself and it's light enough I can lift it in and out of my SUV. The only small thing I wish is that it had an easier way to fold. I'm used to a stroller where you can use your foot or a handle to collapse. This you have to bend down and lift the bar. But that's just a minor inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Koneko82

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this product!
customer_reviews.text: Read the customers' reviews. I bought mine in May 2017. It says it holds 500 pounds. The user of this rollator has a weight that starts with a 2. Still, the wheel fell off seemingly due to a design flaw. Perhaps we should go back to buying things with the MADE IN THE USA label. This Medline is a rip-off and could cause major injury. Buyer beware. This product is dangerous enough that I am shocked amazon is allowing it to be sold on its website. Wish there was a way to give no star at all. Jean Teebken
customer_reviews.author: Jean Teebken

customer_reviews.title: Not Sure if Pros Outweigh the Cons...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Sturdy. Great size pocket under seat. Easy access to pocket. A bit difficult to fold back up. Moves supper fast with no way to slow it down unless your riding the breaks all the time. No break to sit down with so be careful it moves as you go to sit. No lock when its folded so it opens as you lift it to put into a vehicle. Supper heavy. I have to put it in and out of the trunk because it's size and weight. Also, I have to remove the front handles to fit into a standard trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Madu

customer_reviews.title: Wheel fell off
customer_reviews.text: Overall this walker has been very handy. The seat is comfy and wide enough. However the wheel fell off on left front. We found a replacement bearing online and repaired but will have to keep an eye on the other wheels.
customer_reviews.author: S. Densmore

customer_reviews.title: Both walkers cheaply made, and one of the wheels ...
customer_reviews.text: Both walkers cheaply made, and one of the wheels failed on both the S Day and the Medline Heavy Duty Bariatric Roliator. I tried to save a few dollars,, but the Walker description did not live up to its' performance. I both cases the one of the wheels failed. The Nova Mighty Max is outstanding, and last 4+ years under heavy duty use. When I purchased the S Day (rated at 700 lbs.) the Nova Mighty Max was not available. And no, I am not 700 lbs. My theory was that the heavier rated walkers would last longer. The Nova Mighty Max is the one to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: Large and rugged.
customer_reviews.text: This is a larger rollator than most, and takes more trunk space. It is sturdy and can handle a larger man. It travels well, despite the size and is comfortable to sit. Handles adjust well. I advise Velcro straps to store when about, as this has no mechanisms to secure it closed.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Weak wheel joint
customer_reviews.text: The capacity is not accurate, and for anyone approaching 500 pounds, the wheels/wheel springs/joint seem to be the Achilles heel. Had mine 10 months, loved it, but the RF wheel joint is now broken to the point it's ready to simply snap off. Otherwise I thought it was great, although I'd be leery of putting much more than 350-400 pounds on it regularly.
customer_reviews.author: McCalla

customer_reviews.title: wheel bearings defective
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sister who lives in South Africa. I was able to finally get it to her in August after many months of contemplating how to go about it. She called me to say that one of the wheel's bearings had to be replaced! I was very disappointed, since she doesn't even use it to sit on, just for walking. Also since she lives in a nursing home, it was really hard for her to get done.
customer_reviews.author: elmarie vandermerwe

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Durable Poor product support
customer_reviews.text: The 1st six months the walker was dependable After six months the right rear wheel started wobbling and loosing bearings Called the phone support which was helpful, but the response from the product support team was that the product was out of warranty and the wheel would not be replaced. Showed them the Limited lifetime warranty from the product manual, and was told that just covers the frame although it only states that the warranty does not cover non durable parts which are subject to wear. So I assume they mean that items such as the wheels are expected to last lest than six month, which does not seem reasonable. I would recommend avoiding purchasing this product
customer_reviews.author: tuna man

customer_reviews.title: I like it. The larger size suits me better and ...
customer_reviews.text: First order returned because box and rollator was badly damaged. Replacement arrived in damaged box but rollator was okay except can't tighten locking knob on one of the wheels because threaded portion slightly off. I strongly suggest you inspect every part for damage when you receive yours. Otherwise, I like it. The larger size suits me better and is comfortable to sit on.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Read the description
customer_reviews.text: I still cannot fold this walker. Other than that it's great. I use it when it is warmer than it has been so I put it away til it warms up here in, yes, the Bay Area. I love the basket and all else about it. It is heavy. It's for a very heavy person and I didn't realize that. I would love to have one easy to fold. This handles up to a 500 pound person. I may not even be able to lift it into my car trunk. The seat is great. Edit April 1, 2018....I bought the wrong one for sure....very heavy.....don't use much and when I do it's just ok.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen M. Plunkett

customer_reviews.title: Front right wheel locked up - loose parts
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could write a better review but this is 2nd one I've bought and 2nd one with wheel problems. 1st one rear.left wheel fell off after using for 1 year. New one. In less than 2 months use, right front wheel is locked up. Spraying wd40. Hope it works. Update - turns out loose nut caused issue. Tightened up and seems good
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: All-terrain walker
customer_reviews.text: We bought this so that my husband could safely walk on sidewalks that have rocks, raised areas, pine cones and other debris on them. He is 6’3” and 245 lbs. we bought it for the wider width and 8” wheels for stability outside and it has not disappointed. It would be difficult, if not impossible, to use this safely inside with standard-sized doors.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Allthaus

customer_reviews.title: Defective parts
customer_reviews.text: Good heavy duty walker. But the atrium knob just below handle on right side is stripped, just spins around, can’t tighten it. I’m handicapped, bow thrown away so I can’t box up and return it. Son determined it’s the socket receiver on the main front bar that won’t take the screw. I am so afraid of falling, he duct taped the area to allow me to use it
customer_reviews.author: march7752

customer_reviews.title: Awesome A+
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I'm just walking again. It's great. Stready easy to handle. And love u can use it as seat and rest. One issue I'd put some instructions in the box or a note Telling you on the page there is a how to video. Once I figured that out was way easy to put together. But I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Hellie May

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Poor wheel bearings which have been fixed.
customer_reviews.text: Medline makes a fine product. It would be excellent except for the wheel bearings which have failed usually after two months. Medline assures me that they have fixed the problem, but Amazon still stocks and sells the units with the old bearings I just purchased my third rollator in 18 months . The last came directly from Medline via Amazon. Since I like the unit so much, I am prepared to repair it when necessary. Medline’s customer service is a week link and needs some customer oriented training. They are a pain to deal with. All that being said, they really do have a good product. If the wheel bearing issue has been solved, an excellent one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Positive and negative reviews
customer_reviews.text: I've got mixed thoughts about my rollator. It is a little wide for many doors in the house, but I'm making it work. It holds my weight, which is a positive. My cats really enjoy a ride as I walk around the house. It is difficult to fold and stay folded. And it is a little heavy for my wife to put in the car when I have to go out.
customer_reviews.author: Edward  Wells

customer_reviews.title: It's a great one, but WAY Heavier than expected
customer_reviews.text: Customer service was EXCELLENT!! The first box showed signs of damage and when I contacted them, they immediately shipped a new one, no questions asked, and I received it the next day. Returning the damaged one was VERY easy! Easy to assemble. It's comfortable and on a straightway, it's a breeze, but maneuvering is another story and loading it in my vehicle is very difficult. If you have someone to load it for you, then that's not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea deCento

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several of these rollators and this one is flimsy at best. Wheels have never roller without feeling like they are about to come apart. One wheel has broken since my first review, 6 months after purchase, see attached photos.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and great price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome walker. I use it from time to time and love it when I do. It's a bit heavy but as it says it's a heavy duty unit so that the weight is expected. I sit on it as I use it but don't roll around on it so have had no issues with the wheels which are very heavy duty but it isn't made to be a wheel chair. I suspect that the folks who complained about the wheels did exactly this. If you need a wheel chair, buy a wheelchair!
customer_reviews.author: South Texan

customer_reviews.title: Wheels fall off!
customer_reviews.text: Liked this rollator for 7 months. Then a wheel fell off. We were traveling. I called medline and was told the wheels had a 6 month warranty. No local medical supply place had replacement wheels. As a disabled person who relies on a rollator to walk, it was a very difficult few hours. I had to purchase a new overpriced walker ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Almost fell

customer_reviews.title: i love this rollator
customer_reviews.text: i love this rollator. It is made very well. It didnt take my husband too long to put it together for me. It is made of steel so you know it is sturdy. that is what I needed. I am a big lady and i needed and wanted something I would feel secure and safe in. The 300 # limit would have been sufficient but i wanted something stronger.I am quite pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Grant

customer_reviews.title: Dad needed mobility help
customer_reviews.text: My dad had a heart attack and needed help walking. Bring his not young or mobile this comes in very handy for him to move both inside the house and out in public. He uses it daily and likes it so much will use it at the dining room table. So far this one seems better with his movements than the other ( wheel bent and he fell over in the chair!) as wheels seem to be better and stronger.
customer_reviews.author: memek

customer_reviews.title: Great walker at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Received this today. It was very straightforward and simple to assemble. I'm 6'3 and 440 pounds and fought getting a walker for a long time. Just using it around the house I now regret not getting one sooner. It makes walking much easier and provides a comfortable seat when needed. This particular walker was $30 cheaper than the next one in comparison and seeing the quality of this one I'm glad I got it and always appreciate sawing money. My wife has used a walker for a couple years and named it Fred. In keeping with the theme, I've dubbed mine Ethel....
customer_reviews.author: Walter Waitkus

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. This is the mac truck of walkers. The only upside is that with any bump its easy for the person to loose control. Otherwise, I highly recommend. Mom is a little over 300 lbs and its very steady.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and looks good!
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this walker daily and it just what he needed. It truly is a heavy duty walker. I had ordered a different one earlier, but it wasn't sturdy enough for his large frame, but it will be perfect for me if I ever need it. This walker helps him stand upright, and when he gets tired, he can use the attached seat. Easy to assemble and I recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: What a great walker
customer_reviews.text: This thing has really helped me get around a lot better because it's strong and stable. I find myself hot rodding down the hallway the more I use because it's safe and well made. Would certainly recommend to any magnum size people
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Elder

customer_reviews.title: Awesome service
customer_reviews.text: Excellent service speedy delivery quality merchandise great price would but from this seller again ty
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Durable Rollator at a Savings
customer_reviews.text: There is not anything that I don't like about this Medline product. Fast delivery, easy instructions, and no headaches putting this unit together. Barkes are great and hold fast, seat wide and comfortable and that leads to a feeling of safety when using this rollator. You don't need to spend more to get a great walker.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: although my pride was fighting me on finally getting this I am glad I did. Very well made. I weigh 350# and it holds up very well. Only thing though is that in order for it to be so sturdy it is heavy and I have some difficulty getting it in and out of my van. Assemblage was easy.
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this Walker in May 2017. It is ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Walker in May 2017. It is now September and the metal piece that attaches the wheels to the unit has bent so my front wheel won't stay attatched. I called customer service they took forever to get back to me and when they wanted to do a report first before sending me my replacement part. Guarantees there parts not will never buy Medline product again.
customer_reviews.author: Lorien Davoren

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I weigh 335 pounds, and this rollator/walker is excellent. It is sturdy and can handle a lot of use... If I ever have to get another one, I will get this again...
customer_reviews.author: G. Fogel

customer_reviews.title: good option for big and tall
customer_reviews.text: Good price and even at 350 pounds I found this sturdy for how light it is and it is easy to walk with and sit on. Be VERY careful moving on it while sitting, it is easy to flip over backwards when sitting on it (which it has warning stickers telling you to never do but everyone does lol). The wheels on my first one bent after 4 months and the replacement wheels cost half as much as a whole new walker so I just bought a new one. Sometimes they have a hard time folding up and you have to force it but most of the time it folds easily.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew Weaver

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: I am a 350 pound man. I find this sturdy and of decent quality. I had a problem with a wheel and even though the warranty had expired on parts, the company stood behind their product and agreed to send me a wheel at no cost. Great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: The rollator is sturdy and wheels smoothly but for me it's rather heavy ...
customer_reviews.text: The rollator is sturdy and wheels smoothly but for me it's rather heavy and awkward to get in and out of my car. It has nothing built into it that will keep it in its collapsed state and trying to negotiate it into the car in its open state is a pain in the @&!. I use bungees below the seat to keep the unit semi closed. Ugh. Would have been so much easier if they'd added something appropriate themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME PLUS SIZE/BIG & TALL ROLLALATOR
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sturdy product! Instant seat if out doing errands ect. and has a nice storage bag under seat. Nice large wheels and easy to use brakes. Made for a larger individual, and therefore wider seat and very sturdy, metal frame. I love the cranberry color too! Unfortunately, this was a bit too large for my loved one, who uses the smaller version and could not get it through narrower doorframes and had a tough time maneuvering tighter spaces in home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good use walker
customer_reviews.text: Excellant product,except that a hex wrench needs to be added in case(as mine was) the breaks are to tight to let the wheels roll! There should be a strap or something to hold it in the folded up position for when your trying to pick it up an load it in your vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Cosmic Eyes

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Hey when you are disabled and need to get around, this scooter is the best one to get. I'm no light weight, well over 330pds (due to injuries) and it holds me up on smooth and rough surfaces with no problem. Like the storage under the seat, helps a lot to carry items. Well built and rugged.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: An absolute life saver!
customer_reviews.text: I did an exhaustive review of all walkers prior to purchasing this item. This walker is a life saver for me. I need double hip replacement surgery and without this walker, I would not be able to get around at all. It is very sturdy, comfortable and portable. If you're considering a walker, this is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Not as durable as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for a large friend of ours. He weighs 365lbs. The wheel casing broke after 90 days. We were able to order a replacement and fix it. Please keep in mind if the person using this walker leans on it instead of walking with it it will break.
customer_reviews.author: Share Bear L.

customer_reviews.title: More comfortable seat
customer_reviews.text: I need to sit a lot and the seat is not comfortable. Needs better padding. After a while my butt and legs hurt or go numb. Otherwise the height is great cause I can touch the floor with my feet. My last walker I was always on my tip toes. My walker has become my legs. I can cook by sitting on it and swinging around in my kitchen. For that I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I am a large person, needed something I could sit on if walking a distance. Works well in uneven surfaces, folds easily but might be hard for a small person to lift. I used it on s vacation, allowed me to go places I could not walk with just a cane.
customer_reviews.author: barbara price

customer_reviews.title: Quality Walker
customer_reviews.text: Very nice walkler, the seat is wide and comfortable. Love the storage under it, it feels very stable to use.
customer_reviews.author: TMS

customer_reviews.title: IS THERE A DEFECT IN THIS PRODUCT?
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product replaced once and now the same problem has arose again. The right rear wheel does not move properly and has caused me to stumble and almost fall. I need another replacement. I have purchased many items from Amazon over the years and have spent several thousands of dollars. If there is a defect in this product, remove it from your options listed. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Walker
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this walker! Perfect for big and tall people. It increased my ability to walk without worrying about falling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty well made no problems as of yet and I bought it on January of 2020, use it every day. When I get tired I sit on the seat to rest , I weigh 320lbs holds up to my pounds easily. Max 500 lbs you won't go wrong buying this one !!!
customer_reviews.author: Tinman

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I use this at work. I'm a big guy with knee issues. It is great because if I get tired in my travels around the shop I can sit down. It has cut down on my knee pain and I move so much faster around the shop. Should have bought one years ago.
customer_reviews.author: David Gartin

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Jong Wheels fall off wheels crack metal Benz people have been hurt on this thing
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit in standard doorways.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good heavy duty walker, however, we didn’t realize when we bought it for my mother that she wouldn’t be able to take it into places in her house like bathrooms and some bedrooms without partially folding the walker to fit past the doorframe. It holds her well enough, as she is a bit larger than many people her age, and she is able to turn and sit as necessary. I just wish it would be able to go into my standard size bathroom door!
customer_reviews.author: Doreen L. Walker

customer_reviews.title: I liked that the video instructions and steps to assemble the ...
customer_reviews.text: I liked that the video instructions and steps to assemble the walker were very simple and easy to follow. I am very happy with the product, and feel the price was very reasonable. The product is excellent, very sturdy and well made. I didn't like that color blue was not available in the walker, only one color was available. I HIGHLY recommend this walker for anyone under360 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Herrera

customer_reviews.title: We bought this rollator from Amazon in Sept 2016. ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this rollator from Amazon in Sept 2016. Amazon stated the capacity as 500 lbs. Within 14 months the front wheel came off. Threads were stripped. Able to repair enough to be used. Six weeks later it broke off completely. Impossible to find parts. Medline won't provide any replacement info. and Amazon isn't any help. Later we found the capacity as advertised by Medline is 400 lbs. Do your research before buying this or any Medline products
customer_reviews.author: gail miller

customer_reviews.title: solid, big enough wheels
customer_reviews.text: My old roller broke. It wad small wheels and would get stuck. My new Rollator Walker is strong, well made, and with wheels big enough to keep on rolling. This even arrived a day earlier than estimated. Thank you very much.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great rollater
customer_reviews.text: This top layer was really the thing I needed. I can only walk short distances, I can sit and rest a few minutes with this rollater. I added a seat Cushion which helps. I c.an now shop stores i couldn't get in too.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Butz

customer_reviews.title: Very stable and maneuverable
customer_reviews.text: Great for a larger person. My friend loves it and uses it daily. Please note it is heavier than a standard walker as it is made for a heavier person to depend on. So far we have not encountered any issues with door widths.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Litherland

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, go and Live again.
customer_reviews.text: Size is larger than I need but I’m glad because it feels comfortable. First walk already was further than I’ve done in a couple of years. Wow 😮! It is chipped on the handle but I’m keeping it because I’m so glad to have something to help me leave my prison walls, As it were. Buy it NOW.
customer_reviews.author: pupsmumm

product_meta.title: Medline Heavy Duty Rollator Walker with Seat, Bariatric Rolling Walker Supports up to 500 lbs, Large 8-inch Wheels, Burgundy
product_meta.description:
The Medline Bariatric Rollator features a durable steel frame and large 8" wheels. This heavy-duty rolling walker is ideal for persons with health and rehab conditions. It features height adjustable handles and greater distance between the handles for seniors and people that need or want the extra room. Built for comfort, the medical walker has a padded seat and back support, so you can sit and rest in comfort after walking. The foldable design makes it super easy to store away when not in use.

MANUFACTURER CONTACT INFORMATION
8006335463
feature_bullets: HEAVY DUTY STEEL FRAME - The Medline Bariatric Heavy Duty Rollator features a strong, reinforced steel frame to support up to 500 lbs
LARGE 8 INCH WHEELS - Smooth rolling 8 inch wheels with reinforced spokes for extra strength easily roll on all indoor surfaces and outdoor terrain
EASILY FOLDS - Rollator walker folds flat for easy storage and transportation. Walker weighs 25 lbs

LARGER ROLLATOR FOR EXTRA COMFORT - Wide 17.5 inch x 14 inch padded seat with velcro pocket underneath | Width between handles: 23.5 inches | Overall rollator dimensions: 29" W x 44.5" H x 29" D (may not fit through all door frames)
ADJUSTABLE HANDLES - Handles adjust from 31.5" - 37.5" allowing users a more customized fit. Measurements from floor to seat: 22" (not adjustable). Latex free

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
